AcEO (0.1, 0.5 and 1 mg/ml) added to washed platelets inhibited aggregation triggered by thrombin (0.1 U/ml) and ADP (1 μM). The dose 1 mg/ml showed a maximum inhibitory effect of, respectively, 49.73% ± 9.54 (p < 0.01) and 48.20% ± 8.49 (p < 0.05) on thrombin and ADP -induced platelet aggregation. However the doses 0.1 mg/ml and 0.5 mg/ml of AcEO have no significant effect on the antiplatelet effect (Fig. 4).Fig. 4
The originaltrcing and percentage of aggregation inhibition of 0.1, 0.5 and 1 mg/ml of A. campestris L. essential oil (AcEO) on thrombin (a) and ADP (b) induced platelet aggregation. Values are mean ± SEM, n = 6, analysed with one way ANOVA followed by Bonferroni’s post-test; p* < 0.005 vs control and ** < 0.01 vs control
